title: How to Delete Cydia from iPhone/iPod Touch

steps.title: Open Cydia.
steps.content: Open Cydia. You can remove Cydia from your device without losing your jailbreak. Without Cydia, your device won't be able to boot into safe mode if something goes wrong with your jailbreak.

steps.title: Tap the "Installed" tab at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the "Installed" tab at the bottom of the screen. This will open a list of all of your installed packages.

steps.title: Tap a tweak or app that you want to remove from your device.
steps.content: Tap a tweak or app that you want to remove from your device. This will open its Details page.

steps.title: Tap the "Modify" button in the upper-right corner and then tap "Remove".
steps.content: Tap the "Modify" button in the upper-right corner and then tap "Remove". This will add the item to your uninstallation queue.

steps.title: Tap "Continue Queuing".
steps.content: Tap "Continue Queuing". This will allow you to select more packages to add to the uninstallation queue.

steps.title: Repeat the queuing process until you've selected all the packages you want to remove.
steps.content: Repeat the queuing process until you've selected all the packages you want to remove. Return to the "Installed" tab after you have finished queuing.

steps.title: Tap the "Queue" button and then tap "Confirm".
steps.content: Tap the "Queue" button and then tap "Confirm". This will remove all of the packages that you have selected. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Return to the "Installed" tab and select the "User" list.
steps.content: Return to the "Installed" tab and select the "User" list. This will display a list of just the most important packages.

steps.title: Uninstall the "Cydia Installer" package.
steps.content: Uninstall the "Cydia Installer" package. Open the "Cydia Installer"" Details page and tap "Modify". Select "Remove" and then tap "Confirm". Cydia will be uninstalled, and your device will reboot afterwards. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Connect your iOS device to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iOS device to your computer. Use the USB cable to connect your iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch to your computer. Removing your jailbreak will completely remove Cydia and all of the jailbreak tweaks and apps on your device.

steps.title: Open iTunes if it doesn't open automatically.
steps.content: Open iTunes if it doesn't open automatically. You will be using iTunes to backup and restore your device to its factory state, removing the jailbreak and all traces of Cydia. You will lose all of your jailbreak tweaks, but you won't lose any of your data.

steps.title: Select your iOS device at the top of iTunes.
steps.content: Select your iOS device at the top of iTunes. This will open the Summary window.

steps.title: Select "This computer" and then click .
steps.content: Select "This computer" and then click . Back Up Now . This will make a complete backup of your device on your computer's hard drive. The backup process will take a few minutes to complete.

steps.title: Click the .
steps.content: Click the . Restore iPhone/iPad/iPod... button. iTunes will ask you to confirm before the restore process continues. Your iOS device will be wiped clean, which will take several minutes.

steps.title: Load your backup after the restore process is complete.
steps.content: Load your backup after the restore process is complete. After your device has been restored, iTunes will give you the option to setup the device as new or to load a backup file. Select the backup that you just created and choose to restore from it. This will restore all of your data and settings, while eliminating the jailbreak, Cydia, and all of the tweaks and Cydia apps you installed. [3] X Research source Loading the backup will take a few minutes. You can monitor the progress on your iOS device's screen.
